Detailed Description

This class is the main entry point for the Terrain Library, holding library objects such as the terrain renderers.

It also keeps track of the current active renderer, and a reference to the terrain2 defaults DataSection.

The init method must be called before using any terrain code, and fini must be called at the end of the app to release resources.

NOTE: We shouldn't be adding new global objects here, we should instead try to keep objects independent of each other and avoid singletons altogether.

Member Function Documentation

BaseTerrainRenderer * Terrain::Manager::currentRenderer (  ) 

Terrain renderer instance get method.

Returns:
instance of the current terrain renderer. If no terrain renderer has been set, it returs a pointer to a dummy renderer that does nothing.

void Terrain::Manager::currentRenderer ( BaseTerrainRenderer *  newInstance  ) 

This method sets the current terrain renderer instance.

At the moment, TerrainRenderer1 and TerrainRenderer2 call this method when they are inited to set themselves as the current renderer.

Parameters:
newInstance pointer to the current terrain renderer, or NULL to disable terrain rendering.

bool Terrain::Manager::doFini (  )  [protected, virtual]

This method finalises any objects that require finalises in the library, releasing resources.

Returns:
True if fini went on without errors, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from InitSingleton< T >.

bool Terrain::Manager::doInit (  )  [protected, virtual]

This method initialises any objects that require initialisation in the library.

Returns:
True if init went on without errors, false otherwise.
